decks.notes: The main goal of this deck is to control the game through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, hand disruption, and powerful enchantments. Zur the Enchanter serves as a versatile commander, allowing you to search for important enchantments to further cement your control over the game. The deck includes a wide range of removal options, such as Swords to Plowshares and Damnation, as well as counterspells like Force of Will and Mana Leak to stop your opponent's threats. With cards like Bitterblossom and Steel of the Godhead providing additional value, this deck aims to disrupt your opponent's plans while building your own board presence and card advantage to secure victory.

The deck focuses on using various tutor effects to search for key combo pieces and graveyard recursion cards to set up powerful combos utilizing The Mimeoplasm as the commander. The main goal is to quickly fill the graveyard with key creatures and then use reanimation spells to bring them back with The Mimeoplasm's ability, creating a massive threat on the battlefield. The deck includes a mix of disruptive spells to control the game and protect the combo, as well as ramp spells and mana dorks to ensure quick and efficient mana production. Overall, the strategy revolves around assembling the combo pieces while disrupting opponents' plans to secure a dominant position in the game.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a variety of counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive spells to slow down the opponent's game plan. Geist of Saint Traft serves as the commander, providing a quick clock for the opponent if left unchecked. The deck includes a number of powerful white and blue planeswalkers like Teferi, Mage of Zhalfir and Jace, the Mind Sculptor, along with powerful equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Sword of Feast and Famine to enhance Geist of Saint Traft's effectiveness. The mana base is built to support the control strategy with utility lands like Maze of Ith and Rishadan Port. Overall, the deck aims to grind out the opponent's resources and gain incremental advantages until victory is achieved.

The main focus of this deck is to ramp up quickly and efficiently to cast big creatures and powerful spells. By utilizing cards like Utopia Sprawl, Wild Growth, and other ramp spells, the goal is to accelerate mana production and get ahead of the opponent. Prime Speaker Zegana serves as both a powerful threat and a card draw engine, rewarding the player for having large creatures on the battlefield. The deck also includes cards like Tooth and Nail and Natural Order to tutor up key creatures like Craterhoof Behemoth and Primeval Titan for game-winning plays. Overall, the strategy of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with big creatures and powerful spells through efficient ramp and card advantage.

This deck focuses on utilizing Doran, the Siege Tower's ability to make creatures deal combat damage based on toughness rather than power. This allows for a strong aggro strategy with a mix of powerful creatures and disruptive spells to control the board and push damage through. With a wide range of removal, disruption, and efficient creatures, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly and efficiently. The inclusion of equipment such as Sword of Fire and Ice and Sword of Feast and Famine helps to give Doran and other creatures additional versatility and power. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain it throughout the game, capitalizing on Doran's unique ability to dominate the combat phase.

The main strategy of this deck is to utilize the powerful creature, Griselbrand, as the commander to push forward an aggressive playstyle. The deck includes a variety of removal spells, board wipes, and hand disruption to control the board and eliminate threats efficiently. It also includes ramp cards like Thran Dynamo, Gilded Lotus, and Basalt Monolith to accelerate mana production and play the commander earlier. The deck focuses on disrupting opponents' game plan while building up resources to unleash devastating plays with cards like Yawgmoth's Will and Karn Liberated. With a strong control element and a high power level, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents and dominate the battlefield.

The deck revolves around utilizing Marath, Will of the Wild's abilities to create a threatening board presence and apply constant pressure on the opponent. The deck includes a variety of efficient creatures and powerful spells that can generate incremental advantage and overwhelm the opponent. By combining mana acceleration with threats like Huntmaster of the Fells, Inferno Titan, and Voice of Resurgence, the deck can quickly establish a dominant position on the battlefield. Additionally, the inclusion of disruptive cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Phyrexian Revoker helps to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining a proactive strategy. Overall, the deck aims to efficiently deploy threats, disrupt the opponent's plans, and secure a quick victory through aggressive combat and powerful abilities.

The deck focuses on using Zur the Enchanter to search for powerful enchantments that can control the game. It includes a variety of counterspells, removal spells, card draw, and board wipes to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes key enchantments like Rest in Peace, Detention Sphere, and Darksteel Mutation to deal with threats and shut down opponents' strategies. It aims to establish board control and card advantage while utilizing Zur's ability to fetch important enchantments from the deck. The mana base is built to support the deck's color requirements and provide flexibility in casting spells. Overall, the deck seeks to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents through strategic enchantment plays.
